alert.note: Alert for Central and South Weld County; Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County; Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet; Morgan County; Northeast Weld County; South and East Jackson, Larimer, North and Northeast Grand, Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 10 at 1:44PM MDT until May 11 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall will be possible. * WHERE...Northern front range mountains and foothills, including the Cameron Peak burn scar, as well as the northern I-25 corridor and plains of Weld, Larimer and Morgan counties. * WHEN...From Thursday morning through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Burn Scars will be susceptible to flash flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Moderate to potentially heavy rain at times will lead to an enhanced risk of flash flooding, particularly for areas where soil nears saturation due to antecedent rainfall. For the burn scars, elevations below 9,000 ft should see rain throughout the event, and higher rainfall rates embedded in any thunderstorms could produce an increased risk of flash flooding and debris flows.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
